title: Degree of disorder-regulated ion transport through amorphous monolayer carbon
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,17032-17040
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA01523A, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Shizhuo Liu, Ran Cao, Jiani Hu, Huifeng Tian, Yinhang Ma, Honglei Xue, Zhenjiang Li, Zhixin Yao, Ruijie Li, Peichi Liao, Yihan Wang, Lina Yang Zhang, Ge Yin, U Sasaki, Junjie Guo, Lifen Wang, Xiaoyan Zhang, Wu Zhou, Ji Chen, Wangyang Fu, Lei Liu
We show that amorphous monolayer carbon grown at low temperatures possesses nanopores which's controlled by growth temperatures. Ionic transport measurements verify degree of disorder-regulated behavior, aligning with structural characteristics.
